title.narrative: Community Engagement Support To Public-Private Partnership In New Ger Area Redevelopment In Ulaanbaatar City

description.narrative: This community engagement component will facilitate the community engagement in the MCUD-funded project to ensure that the design and plans of the infrastructure projects are according to needs of the residents, that issues especially pertaining to making land available for the project are adequately discussed and resolved with the community members, and the community members are prepared to participate in the implementation of the infrastructure projects to provide counterpart contribution and paid labor to ensure than some economic benefits through employment accrue to the community members. This project will put in place a local community organization composed of the 168 families capable of taking the lead in addressing their development needs in partnership with government, the private sector, UN-Habitat, and other stakeholders. Their continuing engagement in the projects will build a strong sense of ownership of the processes and results among the members which will sustain the gains of the projects.

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Community inputs in terms of needs, willingness to participate and cooperate with the other stakeholders (i.e. government, the private sector, and UN-Habitat), and issues regarding the investment project’s impacts on their land, houses, and livelihoods, compensation for giving up land or possible resettlement issues, etc. are considered in the over-all plan and design of the investment project.

title.narrative: 1. Community members organized into Community Development Council (CDC) with capacity to analyze their own situations, identify and prioritize their needs, collaborate with partners to develop plan and implement and manage projects responding to priority needs, mobilize their members to provide counterpart contributions to the project, and continually engage with partners to discuss and resolve issues surrounding the project.
